result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyrese T Dixon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Court allows early termination of probation if the defendant completes all conditions of probation.

miscConds.notes:
Full-time work/school (minimum of 20 hours of work per week if in school). 
Obtain HS diploma/HSED/GED.
Attend school.

Cognitive Thinking program. 
Complete a mental health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment. 
Obtain a valid driver's license.
Court allows for expungement if the defendant successfully completes probation.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Provide DNA sample. 
Court ordered the defendant to pay the DNA surcharge by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.  Court waived all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to a finding of indigency.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyrese T Dixon

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tyrese T Dixon in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Tyrese T Dixon.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNTS 6 AND 7:
Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Sentencing proceeded. 
Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 6:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to Count 7, with credit for 169 days time served. 

AS TO COUNT 7:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to Count 6, with credit for 169 days time served. 

AS TO BOTH COUNTS: 
The Court STAYED these sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 2 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- Provide DNA sample. 
- Attend school. 
- Obtain HS diploma/HSED/GED. 
- Full-time work/school (minimum of 20 hours of work per week if in school). 
- Cognitive Thinking program. 
- Complete a mental health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment. 
- Obtain a valid driver's license. 

*Court allows for expungement if the defendant successfully completes probation. 
*Court allows early termination of probation if the defendant completes all conditions of probation.

Court ordered the defendant to pay the DNA surcharge by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.  Court waived all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to a finding of indigency. 

20 day appeal rights given.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Tyrese T Dixon not in court, in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Court accepted transfer of defendant's misdemeanor case from Branch 30.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Tyrese T Dixon not in court, in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for a bail/bond hearing.   Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Court rescheduled scheduling conference date.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tyrese T Dixon in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in person.  Defendant Tyrese T Dixon in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judical notice to case 21CF898 (Waukesha County). Sworn for the State: MPD officer A. Milone  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40. Next court date was given by Judge Shelton clerk. Defense wants to be heard on bail.  Bail/Bond Review scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tyrese T Dixon not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Domask in trial. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Oral No Contact Order with M. G. B.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Tyrese T Dixon in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Tyrese T Dixon in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tyrese T Dixon appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
